required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: 52-week add-on to Metformin Comparison of Saxagliptin and Sulphonylurea, With a 52-week Extension Period
clinical_study.official_title: A 52-Week International, Multi-centre, Randomized, Parallel-group, Double-blind, Active-controlled, Phase III Study With a 52-Week Extension Period to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of Saxagliptin in Combination With Metformin Compared With Sulphonylurea in Combination With Metformin in Adult Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Who Have Inadequate Glycaemic Control on Metformin Therapy Alone.

brief_summary.textblock: Saxagliptin is a new investigational medication being developed for treatment of type 2 diabetes. This study is designed to assess the efficacy and tolerability of saxagliptin in addition to metformin and compare to sulphonylurea in addition with metformin.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) Change From Baseline to Week 52
primary_outcome.description: Adjusted mean change from baseline in HbA1c achieved with saxagliptin added on to metformin versus glipizide added on to metformin at Week 52 (Per Protocol Analysis Set). HbA1c is a continuous measure, the change from baseline for each participant is calculated as the Week 52 value minus the baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants Reporting at Least One Episode of Any Hypoglycaemic Event Over 52 Weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of participants reporting at least one episode of any hypoglycaemic event for saxagliptin added on to metformin versus glipizide added on to metformin over 52 weeks (Safety Analysis Set)

secondary_outcome.measure: Body Weight Change From Baseline to Week 52
secondary_outcome.description: Adjusted mean change from baseline in Body Weight achieved with saxagliptin added on to metformin versus glipizide added on to metformin at Week 52 (Safety Analysis Set). Body Weight is a continuous measure, the change from baseline for each participant is calculated as the Week 52 (LOCF) value minus the baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Slope of the Regressions of Change From Week 24 to Week 52 in HbA1c
secondary_outcome.description: Mean slopes of regression of change from Week 24 to Week 52 in HbA1c for saxagliptin added on to metformin versus glipizide added on to metformin (Per Protocol Analysis Set) achieved by fitting a mixed model with subject specific slopes for the time effect (weeks on randomized treatment was utilized). This analysis gives an assessment of the durability of the HbA1c effect.

intervention.description: Glipizide 5-20 mg capsules (titrated to optimal effect or highest tolerable dose during 18 weeks)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosed with type 2 diabetes,
- Treatment with metformin alone on stable doses of 1500 mg or higher per day for at least 8 weeks prior to Visit 1,
- HbA1c >6.5% and â‰¤10.0%
Exclusion Criteria:
- Type 1 diabetes,
- history of diabetic ketoacidosis or hyperosmolar non-ketonic coma,
- Insulin therapy within one year of enrolment (with the exception of insulin therapy during a hospitalization or use in gestational diabetes)

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 891 participants were enrolled in the study; 33 participants did not enter the treatment period; 858 participants were randomized and treated.

group.title: Saxagliptin + Metformin
group.description: Saxagliptin 5 mg tablets added on to open-label metformin

group.title: Glipizide + Metformin
group.description: Glipizide 5-20 mg capsules (titrated to optimal effect or highest tolerable dose during 18 weeks) added on to open-label metformin

group.title: Saxagliptin + Metformin
group.description: Saxagliptin 5 mg tablets added on to open-label metformin

group.title: Glipizide + Metformin
group.description: Glipizide 5-20 mg capsules (titrated to optimal effect or highest tolerable dose during 18 weeks) added on to open-label metformin

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) Change From Baseline to Week 52
outcome.description: Adjusted mean change from baseline in HbA1c achieved with saxagliptin added on to metformin versus glipizide added on to metformin at Week 52 (Per Protocol Analysis Set). HbA1c is a continuous measure, the change from baseline for each participant is calculated as the Week 52 value minus the baseline value.
outcome.population: Randomized participants who completed the 52 weeks of treatment had both baseline and week 52 HbA1c measurement and had no significant protocol deviations

group.description: Saxagliptin 5 mg tablets added on to open-label metformin

outcome.description: Proportion of participants reporting at least one episode of any hypoglycaemic event for saxagliptin added on to metformin versus glipizide added on to metformin over 52 weeks (Safety Analysis Set)

group.title: Glipizide + Metformin
group.description: Glipizide 5-20 mg capsules (titrated to optimal effect or highest tolerable dose during 18 weeks) added on to open-label metformin

measure.title: Proportion of Participants Reporting at Least One Episode of Any Hypoglycaemic Event Over 52 Weeks
measure.description: Proportion of participants reporting at least one episode of any hypoglycaemic event for saxagliptin added on to metformin versus glipizide added on to metformin over 52 weeks (Safety Analysis Set)

analysis.p_value_desc: Between group comparison significant after controlling overall alpha of the study

outcome.title: Body Weight Change From Baseline to Week 52
outcome.description: Adjusted mean change from baseline in Body Weight achieved with saxagliptin added on to metformin versus glipizide added on to metformin at Week 52 (Safety Analysis Set). Body Weight is a continuous measure, the change from baseline for each participant is calculated as the Week 52 (LOCF) value minus the baseline value.
outcome.population: Randomized participants who took at least 1 dose of double-blind treatment. To be included in the LOCF analysis, participants must have had a baseline and at least 1 post-baseline measurement

group.title: Saxagliptin + Metformin
group.description: Saxagliptin 5 mg tablets added on to open-label metformin

group.title: Glipizide + Metformin
group.description: Glipizide 5-20 mg capsules (titrated to optimal effect or highest tolerable dose during 18 weeks) added on to open-label metformin

measure.title: Body Weight Change From Baseline to Week 52
measure.description: Adjusted mean change from baseline in Body Weight achieved with saxagliptin added on to metformin versus glipizide added on to metformin at Week 52 (Safety Analysis Set). Body Weight is a continuous measure, the change from baseline for each participant is calculated as the Week 52 (LOCF) value minus the baseline value.
measure.population: Randomized participants who took at least 1 dose of double-blind treatment. To be included in the LOCF analysis, participants must have had a baseline and at least 1 post-baseline measurement

class.title: Adjusted Change from Baseline to Week 52

analysis.p_value_desc: Between group comparison significant after controlling overall alpha of the study

outcome.title: Mean Slope of the Regressions of Change From Week 24 to Week 52 in HbA1c
outcome.description: Mean slopes of regression of change from Week 24 to Week 52 in HbA1c for saxagliptin added on to metformin versus glipizide added on to metformin (Per Protocol Analysis Set) achieved by fitting a mixed model with subject specific slopes for the time effect (weeks on randomized treatment was utilized). This analysis gives an assessment of the durability of the HbA1c effect.
outcome.population: Randomized participants who completed the 52 weeks of treatment had both baseline and week 52 HbA1c measurement and had no significant protocol deviations

outcome.title: Hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) Change From Baseline to Week 104
outcome.description: Adjusted mean change from baseline in HbA1c achieved with saxagliptin added on to metformin versus glipizide added on to metformin at Week 104 (Full Analysis Set). HbA1c is a continuous measure, the change from baseline for each participant is calculated as the Week 104 value minus the baseline value.
outcome.population: Number of subjects with observed values at Week 104 was n=184 for saxagliptin + metformin and n=160 for glipizide + metformin

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
